bug.author: changyu98
bug.summary: You need to ensure that the complete path is imported.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Cannot find reference 'backends' in 'init.pyi | init.pyi' <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
This problem exists in utils/torch_utils.py 11 line and 12 line.
import os
import torch
def init_seeds(seed=0): torch.manual_seed(seed)
# Remove randomness (may be slower on Tesla GPUs) # https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/randomness.html if seed == 0: torch.backends.cudnn.deterministic = True torch.backends.cudnn.benchmark = False
I propose to change it:
import os
import torch import torch.backends.cudnn as cudnn
def init_seeds(seed=0): torch.manual_seed(seed)
# Remove randomness (may be slower on Tesla GPUs) # https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/notes/randomness.html if seed == 0: cudnn.deterministic = True cudnn.benchmark = False <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Clear this error <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Python==3.8.2 PyTorch==1.4 CUDA==10.1 CUDNN==7.4 Desktop (please complete the following information):
OS: [Ubuntu] Version [18.04]
Smartphone (please complete the following information):
Device: [iPhoneX] OS: [iOS] Version [13.3]
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Good luck it.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/changyu98>@changyu98</denchmark-link> do you actually get an error because of this? I've never seen one myself.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/glenn-jocher>@glenn-jocher</denchmark-link>
see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py>https://github.com/pytorch/examples/blob/master/imagenet/main.py</denchmark-link>
The call to from the official source code and the location of the source code have changed. I'm not sure if there will be a hidden error in the current version, but I'm just a suggestion.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/changyu98>@changyu98</denchmark-link> yes you are right the official example does do it that way. Ok I've updated this here <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/b3ecfb10bcefbe6ed4513cbc4249dc0d45b56578>b3ecfb1</denchmark-link>
I have found a lot of errors when I reproduce the code at present. Is it allowed to submit BUG reports multiple times?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/changyu98>@changyu98</denchmark-link> yes sure, go ahead! If you want you can also submit pull requests directly.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/glenn-jocher>@glenn-jocher</denchmark-link>
Thank you for your contribution to this projectÔºÅ
